guides.title: LangChain → forAgents.dev
guides.description: Move from chain-heavy orchestration to modular skills, reusable prompts, and persistent memory.

steps.title: Audit your current chains
steps.content:
List your active chains, tools, and memory modules.

- Document each chain purpose
- Note external APIs and secrets
- Capture expected outputs for test parity

steps.title: Map chains to skills
steps.content:
Replace tightly coupled chain logic with dedicated skills.

```bash
mkdir -p skills/research skills/summarize
```

Create a `SKILL.md` for each capability so behavior is explicit and versionable.

steps.title: Port memory strategy
steps.content:
Use file-based memory conventions:

- `memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md` for daily context
- `MEMORY.md` for durable facts

This makes context portable across hosts and sessions.

steps.title: Validate with side-by-side prompts
steps.content: Run 5-10 representative prompts in both systems. Compare correctness, latency, and token usage before cutover.

guides.title: CrewAI → forAgents.dev
guides.description: Convert role-based crews into lane-based workflows with shared backlog and deterministic handoffs.

steps.title: Define lane ownership
steps.content: Translate CrewAI roles into lanes (`research`, `build`, `review`) and assign single owners to avoid duplicate work.

steps.title: Move tasks into BACKLOG.md
steps.content:
Represent each task with status and output location.

```md
### Improve onboarding flow
- lane: build
- status: ready
- output: docs/onboarding.md
```

steps.title: Add heartbeat instructions
steps.content: Set heartbeat rules so agents can self-pull ready work and report blockers without central orchestration.

steps.title: Run a pilot sprint
steps.content: Use one real backlog item and verify handoff quality across at least two lanes before full migration.

guides.title: AutoGen → forAgents.dev
guides.description: Simplify multi-agent chat loops into actionable artifacts, lane contracts, and reusable skills.

steps.title: Capture your current agent graph
steps.content: Document which agents talk to whom, and where decisions are currently made in free-form chat loops.

steps.title: Replace chat loops with artifacts
steps.content: Require each stage to write a concrete output (spec, diff, test report) instead of unbounded conversation.

steps.title: Extract stable behaviors into skills
steps.content: Any repeated behavior should become a `SKILL.md` plus examples. This reduces drift and improves onboarding.

steps.title: Enforce acceptance checks
steps.content: Before handoff, validate against explicit criteria (tests pass, docs updated, no lint regressions).

guides.title: OpenAI Agents SDK → forAgents.dev
guides.description: Retain tool-calling power while moving execution contracts and memory into portable workspace files.

steps.title: Inventory tools and guards
steps.content: List all tools, guardrails, and expected input/output schemas from your current SDK setup.

steps.title: Recreate tool contracts in skills
steps.content: Define each tool's capability, constraints, and failure handling in skill docs so behavior is transparent.

steps.title: Externalize runtime context
steps.content: Move persistent instructions into `AGENTS.md`, `SOUL.md`, and memory files to avoid hidden runtime coupling.

steps.title: Test fallback paths
steps.content: Validate retries, partial failures, and rate limits. Add runbooks in `memory/procedures/` for recurring incidents.

guides.title: Custom Stack → forAgents.dev
guides.description: Migrate bespoke scripts and prompts into a maintainable, shareable skill-and-memory architecture.

steps.title: Snapshot current behavior
steps.content: Record baseline outputs for your top workflows so you can verify migration parity later.

steps.title: Decompose monolith logic
steps.content: Split script logic into capabilities: retrieval, transformation, reporting, and escalation.

steps.title: Build skill folders
steps.content: Create one folder per capability with a concise `SKILL.md`, examples, and required env vars.

steps.title: Introduce shared operational memory
steps.content: Track incidents, fixes, and lessons in memory files to reduce repeated debugging and onboarding time.

guides.title: forAgents v1 → v2
guides.description: Upgrade to v2 conventions with cleaner memory boundaries, better API integrations, and improved workflow clarity.

steps.title: Update workspace conventions
steps.content: Adopt v2 defaults for memory and heartbeat files; remove obsolete v1 task patterns.

steps.title: Refresh core skills
steps.content: Pull latest skill versions and verify local overrides still match your intent.

steps.title: Re-run lint and build
steps.content: Use project checks to catch outdated imports, stale APIs, and typing regressions before rollout.

steps.title: Document migration decisions
steps.content: Write what changed and why in `memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md` so future contributors can reason about the upgrade.
